Bruce,
  So simple, but from what I've read about all this, it seems this focus on the manual manipulation of the dial would take away a lot of the experimenter's focus.  No?
  So far I've been using a radio tuned to a staticy Polish-language station, on the advice of Mark Macy, who apparently had his best results with staticy foreign AM broadcasts.  This is how I got my first voice.  But I'm seeing from the posts on this group that any audible language is seen as non-conducive to capturing voices.  
  Please advise!

bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
          Ursula,
 
The simplest and closest method to a frank's or joe's box you can use to obtain real time communication
is called the manual sweep method. This method actually duplicates to a certain extent the workings of an actual box
but instead of mechanical dial sweep you use your hand to sweep the dial. All you need is a radio with a manual dial adjust
not the digital setting kind but the old fashioned knob tuning kind, a recorder and an open mind.
 
Just set the radio to either the am or fm band and tune the knob so that it sweeps back and forth from one end of the dial to the other
make sure that you sweep fast enough so that the radio does not stop on any one station or catch any full words or phrases that are radio signal
try not to sweep so fast that everything is a complete blur and you can hear nothing. With this method as you progress you will naturally fall into 
a groove of how to manually manipulate the dial for the best results. As you are sweeping the dial make sure your recorder is turned on and start 
to ask simple questions that in the beginning only require a one or two word answer and you will hear the questions answered. 
You may also hear your name and if your lucky a three or four word phrase or two. I'm sure your saying how will I know the difference 
between radio words and spirit communication, well If you ask "hi are there any spirits listening" and the radio says "hi Ursula" then you can be 
pretty sure it's not radio fragment. the reason you will record the sessions is you will not be able to hear all the responces in real time due to the speed of the sweep.
 
Bruce

Welcome to the group. My name is Bruce, I am one of the individuals on this group that does

There are a couple of other methods that you can use that some of us here at the group find a bit

need one of the boxes to experiment with them. If you are interested in giving them a try just
let me know I would be happy to explain to you how to get started.

      Hello,
This is my first post to the group. My name is Ursula, and I am a 
Chicago-based writer who has written a number of books on Chicago's 
supernatural history and folklore. I just started a regular program 
of ITC experimentation a week ago today, after receiving several 
books from Mark Macy after he spoke at our Chicago Ghost Conference 
in October. Macy immediately struck me as an intensely sincere, 
peaceful person, and I wanted some of what made him that way. I soon 
found out that his demeanor flows from his connection to and 
knowledge of the other side, which he has garnered through ITC. With 
Mark's advice to guide me, I put together a very simple setup and 
began recording for about ten minutes each morning at eleven. I got 
my first voice on Wednesday and, though it was a bit chilling, I was 
and am fascinated. This was a huge step for me because, like a lot 
of "ghost hunters" I was fascinated by voice phenomena but never 
wanted it in my own house! Previously, the thought of recording in 
my own home was terrifying, but now that I understand the bridge-
building idea of ITC (as a separate thing from recording EVP at 
haunted sites)it's actually bringing me a lot of peace and focus.

My husband and I operate Chicago Hauntings tours, and we started our 
company in part to try to "un-haunt" some of the tragic sites in the 
city. We feel that by taking guests to the locations to tell the 
often covered-up stories of the dead there we can help send on some 
of the negative energies/entities. ITC seems to really speak to this 
idea, in the way that it helps us all grow spiritually BEFORE we pass 
over, so that we don't get "left behind" here when it's time to 
transition.

Anyway, those are some of the inital feelings and thoughts I have as 
I start this program. I am eager to pick up feelings, thoughts (and 
tips) from other experimenters. Thanks again for having me!
